title: Accessing site page problems
content:
Hi,

I am having a problem accessing pages (or popups, I'm not sure) on certain pages.

When I log into specific sites (e.g. Lightspeed, GoDaddy or Shopify) I have a problem opening certain areas. One of the obvious and annoying ones is when I try to access the Live Chat on Lightspeed. The chat is never available for me even though it is 24/7 (see image below showing chat unavailable), but I can access it if I log in on a New Private Window or use a different browser (see second image below, showing chat available).

Is this an easy fix? I tried adding the sites as exceptions but it made no difference, I am obviously missing something.

Thanks for your help. Samantha
creator: sjweikel

title: FireFox is not responding, also impossible to reinstall properly (windows 10)
content:
Hello,

Yesterday I opened firefox as usual but it was not responding, I closed it opened it again same thing, restarted the computer, same issue. When I tried to uninstall it, the uninstaller got stuck https://imgur.com/mxT0KxR

I forced the uninstaller to close, deleted the firefox folder from program files, and tried to reinstall again, and it got stuck again at: Execute "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\default-browser-agent.exe" register-task 308046

https://imgur.com/Uk3JMNI

and when I force the installer to close, Firefox is installed but hangs and does not respond at startup.

I've already tried refreshing it but the same issue persists. I also don't have any antivirus and I tried disabling Windows Defender, Please Help! Thank you.
creator: hiruma91

title: Cap Youtube bandwidth/resolution?
content:
Is there any way to cap Youtube bandwidth/resolution, including through add-ons or even indirectly through add-ons that require to download additional file or paste text in?

I have a monthly bandwidth cap and I try to keep watching Youtube at 480p but sometimes it's higher; I get annoyed when it's 720p and panic when it's >= 1080p. Sometimes there's numerous 480p videos in a row so I stop looking at the cog for the red HD indicator, then realize a video has been guzzling my limited bandwidth.

Thank you kindly for your help
creator: DynV

title: Download "Chiedi sempre" non funziona
content: Buongiorno, chiedo aiuto per un problema che riscontro da alcuni giorni, dopo uno degli ultimi aggiornamenti del browser. Uso Firefox da molti anni e ho sempre impostato i download dei file su "Chiedi sempre" per scegliere se scaricarli o aprirli direttamente. Da un po' di tempo, nonostante io abbia mantenuto nelle Impostazioni, File e applicazioni, sia in Download sia in Applicazioni "Chiedi dove salvare ogni file", mi costringe sempre a salvarlo sul PC. Cosa che spesso rallenta il mio lavoro, visto che scarico molti Word e PDF inviatemi dalle case editrici. Ho seguito il tutorial, le impostazioni sono corrette ma continua a volere per forza salvare il file sul PC. Ho Windows 10 Home e uso sia la posta di Aruba sia Gmail. Su entrambe si comporta allo stesso modo. Bitdefender lo uso da anni e non mi ha mai creato problemi in questo senso. Come posso fare? Vi invio lo screenshot delle impostazioni. Grazie mille per l'attenzione. Daniela Ariano
creator: info7166

title: Tab close after following the link
content:
Heeeeeeeelp,

since yesterday, I can not use the tabs propperly anymore: when I make a google search, and I click on a link, it pops up a new tab, and the google search tab closes. so I can not go back to my search, since it is a new tab and it has no previous page. my previous serch tab, is closed, the only way to acess it is to reopen closed tab. this is very annoying.

I only had this problem when I was geting a facebook search result, this always poped up in a new tab and closed the search tab.

but now it happens all the time what is the problem? regards f.

title: Noscript 11.4 working properly?
content: I just noticed that the Noscript extension has taken on an odd look, far different from its normal look. usually it's depicted as blue witha red circle, where now it looks markedly different. Furthermore, the drop down menu is now in black and white. I am aware that Noscript just went to version 11.4, but is this part of the changes, or is something weird happening here? I've never seen it change logos or setup like this in all the time its existed. Can someone confirm if this is a normal thing or a glitch? It literally changed icons on me just a few minutes ago for no reason I can determine. I am including images of the icons/logo as it is supposed to look, plus the new weird appearance.
creator: Marc7

title: Firefox Deceptive Site partner in China
content:
In China (Mainland) the Firefox Now showing both Associate Press and Russian sputnik concerning Ukraine as "Deceptive Site" (e.g. https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-putin-europe-nato-49abe49e9b35833a385fe10db802dc5a). So I have 2 questions.

1 Who is responsible for the collection of Deceptive Site in China (for those who don't know, Chinese Firefox is run and supported by "Beijing Zhimou firefox", not mozilla) 2, and more importently. what information would it need to be sent to use the "Deceptive Site" function (or more sepsifictly, is firefox sending what sites I visit to its partner? and if yes what, and who)

title: How to use different themes on different profiles
content: I have three Firefox profiles: A, B, and C. I tried to give them all different themes. A has a red theme and keeps it consistently. B, my default profile, should have a green theme, and C should have a black theme. However, when I change B's theme to green, the theme on C also changes to green, and when I change the theme on C to black, the theme for B also changes to black. I don't know what I did differently for A! How can I make my profile themes stick for B and C?

title: Firefox opens but doesn't load any sort of web page
content:
I just got a new computer, and Firefox did work at first, but then something happened, I don't know what, and then Firefox just stopped working. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, did Refresh, tried to start it up in Troubleshoot mode, and nothing works. It'll open, and it'll show bookmarks, but if I try to go to a website, it just sits there and doesn't do anything. Doesn't act like it loads no matter how long I let it sit. I've tried to do about:config to maybe turn off ipv6 or http3, i type in about:config and it doesn't load. I tried to go to settings or to view passwords and it just puts in about:login...... in the address bar and just sits there. I'm not sure what's going on and any advice would be welcome. I've uninstalled all AV and am currently just using windows defender firewall, which I have also disabled as well and it didn't make a difference. Any advice or tips or fixes would be more than welcome.

Firefox also doesn't shut down when I close it. I have to close it in task manager in order to start it up again
creator: michelle_325
